description: Played it some hours was great to kill and challenge my brain.
summary: It's a great game to pass time and use the brain

description: A nice GNOME Game indeed but i wish if it was more on par with Qbeez

No fun, due to their failure to implement basic game design concepts:
- gradual increase in difficulty. E.g. through levels
- supporting the player's sense of achievement. E.g. through a high-scores list

Doing the above would probably have made this into a decent early 80s game. For a more modern feel, you'd probably need other increases in difficulties (e.g. problematic special tiles, new tiles showing up unexpectedly, time pressure, etc.), other complications (e.g. helpful special tiles), and perhaps some world-wide high (and not so high) score list.

BTW: in a normal gnome desktop the "preferences" are in the top bar, not in the application's window. That probably why some reviewers didn't find out to resize the playing board.
summary: Barely qualifies as a computer game

description:
The final score will be the sum of (n-2)^2 points and 1000 points if cleared.
I uploaded my video playing this game but YouTube removed it because it violated spam, deceptive practices and scams policies. Why?
My favorite game.

It is a good game and fun as well as a good way to spend time when there is not much else to do. But it also has a problem as it will lock the computer when you click on the "close" button in the top right corner of the window, like MS Windows does at times. If you have an Intel based computer, especially with an Core i7 CPU, until you go into "root" and remove the "amd-ucode" and correctly add the "Intel-ucode". Then everything works better.

Schönes Spiel, manchmal etwas frustrierend :D
Es macht auch Spaß mal zu versuchen fast keine Punkte zu bekommen.

Leider ist das Feld sehr klein. Aber dafür funktioniert es einwandfrei. Und man bekommt über 1000 Punkte, wenn man es schafft, alle Teile vom Spielfeld zu entfernen. Das ist mir bei anderen Varianten dieses Spiels so gut wie nie gelungen. Es erfüllt also wirklich seinen Zweck. Man kann knobeln und entspannen, mal so eben zwischendrin.
